name: Hotel Riu Santa Fe

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in August. We were originally booked for 7 but decided to upgrade to the Palace for the last half of the week (and were very glad we did).
reviews.title: Good but Palace was better

reviews.text: LOCATION: close to Costco, Walmart and Cabo. Can walk to all but Cabo is a tough one along the beach. Beach has wicked waves. Great fun to watch but very dangerous to swim in or try to get in/out of a water taxi here. Great view of Lands End but cannot see the Arch from any hotel in the area unless you go on a boat.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING

reviews.text: CHECKIN: quick & hassle free. Margarita served upon arrival. Bags delivered to room quickly.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL, GREAT SERVICE, EXCELLENT VACATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: Didn't like: metal key, packets of soap/shampoo, limited channels on old tube TV, no in-room coffee maker. Liked: digital safe, shower pressure, frosty well-stocked mini-bar, drying rack on balcony, fan & AC
reviews.title: We had a great time! The beach volleyball was great!

reviews.text: FOOD: No problem getting reservations for a la cartes. Asian was not great but loved the sushi/sashimi. Mexican was very good and all served to the table. Buffet had tons of options - we looked forward to breakfast every morning! Lunch buffets are outside - salads & desserts are in a cooler with sliding glass panels so bugs stay out.
reviews.title: Fun Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip started off to a bit of a rocky start although it has nothing to do with the hotel. We booked through Jubilee Travel in Vancouver and we did not receive any instructions for our transport from the airport to the hotel. In Cabo this proved to be very important. Once you depart your plane, collect your baggage and clear customs you will come out to a large room lined with many desks and workers wearing bright coloured shirts. They all look very official and have badges but they are all working for timeshares. If you ask them they will tell you that they are with whatever tour company you say you are looking for. When you go through the next set of doors you will encounter the same thing. Once outside of the airport you will find the REAL transfers. Had someone explained this to us we may not have missed our transfer. As it was it turned out fine. The Terramar rep outside felt bad for us and had a suburban come pick us up.
reviews.title: Smoking Hot Vacation! RIU Santa Fe R&R

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival to the RIU Santa Fe...This was a bit lack lustre. There was no line-up (probably due to being late) but the guy at the front desk was not very welcoming and rushed us through. He almost seemed annoyed when we asked a few questions. We were assigned a room in building 3. We were quite surprised that the hotel was as big as it is as the internet site does not do it justice. Building 3 is right outside one of the pools and is fairly close to all of the amenities.
reviews.title: Worst hotel in all of CABO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room...The room was great. It was clean and the decor is very contemporary. The king bed could have used an extra pillow (4 instead of 3) and the bed was a bit too firm for me. The safe is way too small for a laptop and I would be surprised if it could fit an iPad. I have a 13" Macbook and there is no way it would fit so I was happy to have read previous reviews about this. The balcony has a clothes rack to dry off your bathing suits which is nicer than hanging them off a chair or the railing. The toiletries are pretty much non existent. You get the standard bars of soap but the shampoo, conditioner, and body wash come in ketchup style packages...not worthy of a 5 star resort.
reviews.title: Good but not great wish there was a better beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pools...The pools on this resort are great. There is a large infinity edge pool out at building 7 over looking the beach. There are also 2 more small infinity edge pools with swim up bars at building 7. While we were there (09/17/11 - 09/24/11) the pools at building 7 were the party pools. This is where the aqua aerobics take place and seems to be where the activity workers spend most of their time. The other large pool is by building 3, 4, 5, etc. This pool has a swim up bar all though it was not open while we were there. This was the quieter of the pools and was fairly empty. We were told that the hotel was only 40% full so we never had to reserve a lounge chair...there were still chairs free in the shade or under umbrellas as late as 11:00am. We spent time at all of the pools and there were all very clean and always seemed to be tended by someone.
reviews.title: Could Not Believe How Many Disappointments!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Food...to reserve for the specialty restaurants you must go to the main lobby in the morning. If it is Sunday morning they will allow you to book for Sunday evening and Tuesday evening, on Monday you can book for Monday evening and Wednesday evening...etc. The steak house (in building 7) was not impressive at all. We were extremely disappointed and we went in with low expectations after reading the reviews. The mexican restaurant was very good and probably the best out of the 3 specialty restaurants we tried. The Italian was not very good at all and was part buffet part a la carte. The buffet (La Baja California) was excellent on special nights (mexican night and caribbean night were the best). Check out the food that that cook outside on these nights.
reviews.title: Almost excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance' and I stayed at the Royal Solaris, San Jose del Cabo two years ago. It was a very nice peaceful place and a decent price. After hearing several things about the RIU, we decided to give it a shot. We wanted to be married in Mexico, and decided to make RIU the destination. Our friends had stayed at RIU before and loved it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, check-in was cake. You are greeted with a beer or margarita when you arrive, and it took only about 20 minutes to check in.
reviews.title: Great place for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next let's talk about the rooms. They were very clean, well stocked with towels, and everything that you would expect in a room. We asked for more towels and received them immediately. Any request we made was fulfilled quickly. And to keep it in perspective, other than sleeping, we spent a total of approximately one hour in our room each day.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location and Pool. Awful food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good. Was it Ruth's Chris? No. Was it P.F. Chang's? No. This is an all-inclusve resort. If you have never been to an all-inclusive, I will tell you that you should not expect a $35.00 steak at the steakhouse. The food is not what most Americans are used to, as you ARE in MEXICO.
reviews.title: Great Resort!

reviews.text: The morning buffet was excellent. You hade a choice of any type of egg, omelets or eggs made-to order, potatoes, a multitude of fruits, juices. breads, smoothies, and dairy products.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really can't say much negative about this resort. The pools were great, food was tasty (go Italian!), all the grounds were kept clean ... etc etc. All that you'd expect from a Riu Resort. BUT, I wish we would have known about the beach. Totally un-swimable. My husband and I like to spend at least a little time on the beach ... otherwise, it's just like going to anyother resort in any other place. Wish we would have known about the beach situation.
reviews.title: Excellent ... except not a beach vacation
Never Disappointed
reviews.text: Also, if you're planning on drinking, avoid your hotel minibar. The drinks are of low quality and the hangovers are a lot worse. Stick to the bars where they serve the good stuff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to the RIU Sante Fe and we will go back again. The staff are all wonderful and make you feel so welcome. In particular the entertainment staff are incredible and the pool aerobics are a blast. The restaurants are all good though probably this is the weakest part of the resort. Lots to choose from so if you don't enjoy one, you will for sure enjoy another. Great selection in the general buffet and this was never a disappointment. The town is not too far, cab or bus ride is easy. Depending on the weather the beach is risky to swim but the pools are great. All inclusive is the way to go!!
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: I stayed at the Riu Santa Fe in April with a group of 3 couples in the ranging from 25-35 years old. We had a great stay! The resort was spotless, had everything you would need and more. The view was absolutely gorgeous. The walk to town on the beach was a bit of an exercise due to the coarse sand and the steep incline to the ocean but it was well worth it. No swimming in the ocean at this resort - and when you get there you'll see why! The waves were huge - but amazing to watch. If you walk down the beach towards town a few minutes there are designated swimming spots where the waves are more tame. The food was good, not much Mexican food at all though, they cater more to the American tourists. Staff were very nice and accommodating. Overall - We all loved the resort and had no real complaints - Would love to go back!
reviews.title: Would definitely go back!

reviews.text: I went to Riu Santa Fe in March of 2011 and had to make sure that I reviewed this hotel. I was really impressed with the grounds of the hotel, the staff was AMAZING, drinks were great, food was okay, and the location is awesome. I would definitely recommend going to the Marina a few times to eat, the restaurants are amazing.
reviews.title: Staff is one of the best

description: * Located in the southern Baja California peninsula, 4.5 km/2.8 miles from Cabo San Lucas * Opened winter 2007/8 * 1-story main building and 3-story and 4-story annexes * On the beachfront * Complimentary sun loungers on the beach * 3.5 km/2.2 miles from downtown Cabo San Lucas * 40 km/25 miles from the airport * 500 m/1650 ft from a bus stop
